column4: is there a known problem with processor on dual core processors?  Watching my processor usage the processors are being 'used' about the exact same - even though I have a task that should only be utilizing one processor with any sort of load
that's probably the linux scheduler shuffeling stuf around
you can probably stop it from doing that by doing: echo 1 > /sys/devices/system/cpu/sched_mc_power_savings
my processor is an AMD 64 x2 if that affects anything
Why do you want to prevent linux from scheduling jobs on multiple cores anyway?
I'd just like to kill the ridiculous amount of noise my fan is making under linux
uhm... then you are probably after the wrong problem
you should check if ondemand cpu governor is used
actually what I've read of the command you just pasted stated that that reduces power usage - ergo fan usage
are you on a laptop or on a desktop?
uhmm... try www.linuxpowertop.org and do the tips it suggests
